attributes.action: All Traffic Lights Should Detect Motorcycles
attributes.additional_details:
Many traffic lights that work using a censor system often do not detect motorcycles, particularly light ones.

This is increasingly an issue in more rural areas and especially in situations where temporary lighting systems such as those used at roadworks are involved.

All motorcycles pay their excise duty, so should have equal access to road network and should not be left waiting for long periods of time at lights which have not detected them.
